meanings.definition: To transfer or adapt (software) for use on a different platform.
meanings.sent1: I ported the game to my new computer so I could play it.
meanings.sent2: The developers decided to port the app to both iOS and Android devices.
meanings.sent3: Trying to port a cooking app to a gaming console would be quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: She ported her creativity from painting to digital design effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The team successfully ported the software, making it compatible with various operating systems.

meanings.definition: To carry or transport (goods or people) from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The truck ported the goods from the warehouse to the store.
meanings.sent2: We need a ship to port the supplies to the island.
meanings.sent3: Imagine a giant bird porting people to work instead of cars!
meanings.sent4: The ants ported the food to their anthill with impressive teamwork.
meanings.sent5: The train ported passengers across the country, offering a scenic journey.

meanings.definition: To turn (a ship or aircraft) to face a different direction.
meanings.sent1: The captain ported the ship towards the open sea.
meanings.sent2: The pilot will need to port the plane to avoid the storm.
meanings.sent3: It would be funny to see a ship porting in circles like a confused duck!
meanings.sent4: The wind ported the sailboat effortlessly, guiding it to safety.
meanings.sent5: The aircraft ported smoothly, changing course towards the destination.
